alert.note: Alert for Caldwell; Calloway; Christian; Crittenden; Graves; Hopkins; Livingston; Lyon; Marshall; Trigg; Webster (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 07 at 4:33AM EST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Calloway, Livingston, Crittenden, Christian, Caldwell, Marshall, Trigg, Hopkins, Webster, Graves and Lyon Counties through 415 AM CST... At 331 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Marion to 6 miles north of Eddyville to near Calvert City to near Mayfield to near South Fulton. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Princeton, Farmersville and Creswell around 345 AM CST. Benton, Providence and Eddyville around 350 AM CST. Other locations in the path of these storms include Olney, Lynnville, Sedalia, Dawson Springs, Madisonville, Murray, Land Between The Lakes Area, Earlington, Mortons Gap and Cobb. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 AM CST for western, south central and northwestern Kentucky.

area.areaDesc: Caldwell; Calloway; Christian; Crittenden; Graves; Hopkins; Livingston; Lyon; Marshall; Trigg; Webster
